p: Countries have found that COVID‐19 differently affects people according to the age. For example, Korea Centres for Disease Control and Prevention 31 reports that severe cases of COVID‐19 according to age groups as follows: children (0%), teens (0%), adults (25.0%), and elderly (75.0%) as of 18 June 2020. The Office for National Statistics 32 in the UK shows the COVID‐19 deaths according to age groups as follows: 0–15 years (0.0%), 15–44 years (1.1%), 45–64 years (9.7%), and 65+ years old (89.2%). The New York City Health 33 shows that the COVID 19 deaths of people are differentiated by the age as of 13 May 2020 as follows: 0–17 years old (0.06%), 14–44 years old (3.9%), 45–64 years old (22.4%), 65–74 years old (24.9%), and 75+ years old (48.7%).
